channel.title: Can't change connection the client uses to sign in
channel.description: I've searched for a similar topic, found 1, but the people who answered misunderstood what the person was asking, so I will try to clear up what I'm about to ask: I have downloaded a client, Demise PK'ing client. I'm no expert to mopar and its been a while since I've been on here. Now, my source runs and compiles fine, as well as this client. I can log on just fine, but the problem is it ONLY uses localhost to sign on. My friend has the same source and client and we can't figure out how to adjust what ip it uses to connect to. (There is no "File" option to click on at the top left, or "ip" option under username and password, I simply can't find it.) This has happened on 2 other clients as well. I may be behind on the times... but can someone help?

item.title: Can't change connection the client uses to sign in

item.description:

Jeremyxx:

What Does Anti Leeech Dooo???

What a stupid question… What does it sound like it does?

item.title: Can't change connection the client uses to sign in
item.dc:creator: @aers20 aers20
item.description:
@aers20 wrote:

[quote=“k0 twin, post:2, topic:373464”]Search the client files for “localhost”, “127.0.0.1” “0.0.0.0” “server =” or “serverip =”

Change the IP to the one you want (Ex: myserver.no-ip.biz)[/quote]

Cant, at demise client there is a anti leech

Read full topic
